intro: Mitrasacme polymorpha, commonly known as the variable mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
